question: How many FM transmitters are to be set up in the premises of SSB along the Indo-Nepal border?
explanation:
Government has approved seven projects to set up Frequency Modulation (FM) transmitters in the premises of Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB). The announcement was made by Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar. The aim of the approval of FM transmitters is to strengthen FM coverage along the Indo-Nepal border.
The projects would be in three states namely Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. The transmitters will be set up in: Narkatiaganj (West Champaran), Bathnaha (Araria), Sitamarhi in Bihar, Champawat, Uttarakhand, Nanpara (Bahraich), Gadaniya (Lakhimpur Kheri), and Maharajganj in Uttar Pradesh.
